name: natural gas, high pressure, domestic supply with seasonal storage | natural gas, high pressure | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25423/documentation

This dataset represents the supply of natural gas [m3], including energy requirements and losses+emissions from seasonal storage, from domestic production in the United Kingdom.;Reference(s):;Bussa, M., N. Jungbluth, Ch. Meili (2023) Life cycle inventories for long-distance transport and distribution of natural gas. ESU-services Ltd. Schaffhausen, Switzerland. Available from: http://esu-services.ch/data/public-lci-reports/

The activity starts from the outbound gate of the natural gas production plants.

This dataset covers the gas losses and emissions during seasonal storage of domestic supply. The dataset “Natural gas, burned in gas turbine” is used to account for the emissions and infrastructure of the operational energy requirements of the storage capacities. The infrastructure of the storage is neglected in this study as it is assumed to be insignificant. Long-distance pipeline transport from the place of production to the regional distribution networks is not considered. The activity ends at the "entry gate" of national markets for natural gas at high pressure.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/352:Manufacture of gas; distribution of gaseous fuels through mains/3520:Manufacture of gas; distribution of gaseous fuels through mains

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: An average leakage rate of 0.1% of the gas stored was used by Bussa et al. (2023), based on previous studies. Furthermore, Bussa et al. assumed that 15% of total natural gas supply is temporarily stored, based on European Commission (2015), for all geographies covered.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The consumption mixes for regions and non-european countries were calculated based on the production and trade statistics provided in BP (2022) . Data from Eurostat (2023) were used to modell consumption mixes for European countries. The British consumption mix is based on data from the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS 2022).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Literature. Online calculators for distances. The data for storage emissions are based on global data. The share of gas stored is a rough estimate based on European data. The average weighted transport distance is based on the trade movements 2021.

exchanges.description: Output (corresponding to 1 MJ based on the net calorific value of 36 MJ/Sm3)
